title: Info and Relationships
quote: So this button does...what exactly? Is it a mystery box?

teamRecommendations.dev: Use semantic markup to maintain a meaningful sequence in the DOM.

title: Sensory Characteristics
quote: So I should 'Click the round, red button.' Great, but what if I can't see 'round' or 'red'?
suggestionForIllustration: A visually impaired character confused by a webpage instructing to click a button based only on its shape and color.
wcagDescription: Instructions provided for understanding and operating content do not rely solely on sensory characteristics of components such as shape, size, visual location, orientation, or sound.

teamRecommendations.pm: Include multiple identifiers for actionable items beyond just sensory characteristics.
teamRecommendations.ux: Supplement sensory cues with text or auditory descriptions.
teamRecommendations.dev: Implement textual labels alongside sensory characteristics in instructions.
teamRecommendations.qa: Test to make sure instructions are clear even when visual or auditory cues are absent.

title: Orientation
quote: Hey, I didn't tilt the world, so why are you forcing me to tilt my screen?
suggestionForIllustration: A character in a wheelchair struggling to rotate a tablet for landscape view.
wcagDescription: Content does not restrict its view and operation to a single display orientation, such as portrait or landscape, unless a specific display orientation is essential.

teamRecommendations.pm: Allow for both portrait and landscape orientations unless it's crucial to the function of the feature.
teamRecommendations.ux: Design UI layouts that adapt gracefully to changes in orientation.
teamRecommendations.dev: Implement responsive design that accommodates various screen orientations.
teamRecommendations.qa: Test that the site or app functions well in both portrait and landscape modes.

thankfulNote: Now I can use my device my way! You've put me back in control!

title: Identify Input Purpose
quote: I love surprises, but not when filling out forms. Tell me what you want already!
suggestionForIllustration: A character puzzled by an input field on a form with no labels or hints.
wcagDescription: The purpose of each input field collecting information about the user can be programmatically determined when the input field serves a purpose identified in the Input Purposes for User Interface Components section.

teamRecommendations.pm: Ensure all input fields in forms have clear and understandable labels.
teamRecommendations.ux: Use placeholders, tooltips, or helper text to guide the user on what information is required.

teamRecommendations.qa: Verify that all input fields are easily identifiable and functional.

teamRecommendations.ux: Design visible and easy-to-use audio controls on the media player.
teamRecommendations.dev: Implement audio controls that can be easily accessed and used.
teamRecommendations.qa: Test to make sure audio controls are functional and accessible on different devices.

teamRecommendations.dev: Use CSS to set text and background colors that meet the minimum contrast requirements.

suggestionForIllustration: A character coming back to a computer with a "session timed out" message, holding a coffee cup in frustration.

teamRecommendations.pm: Clearly communicate any timeouts that might result in data loss.

teamRecommendations.dev: Code to strictly limit any flashing elements and confirm they meet AAA standards.
